SEARCH
Package BinarySearchTreeCLI

Class BinarySearchTree<T extends Comparable<? super T>>

java.lang.Object
BinarySearchTreeCLI.BinarySearchTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the element type stored in this tree; must implement Comparable
public final class BinarySearchTree<T extends Comparable<? super T>> extends Object
An AVL (self-balancing) binary search tree (BST) implementation.

This tree supports creation, insertion, deletion, and traversals (in-order, pre-order, post-order). After each insertion or deletion, the tree automatically rebalances using the AVL rules so that the height difference (balance factor) of any node is in {-1, 0, 1}.

Notes:

  • Duplicates are ignored (inserting an existing value has no effect).
  • All operations assume keys are non-null and mutually comparable.

      public boolean isEmpty()

      Returns:
      true if the tree contains no elements; false otherwise

      Throws:

      public List<T> traverse(BinarySearchTree.Traversal t)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a list of keys in the specified order (empty if the tree is empty)

    • fromSortedList

      public static <E extends Comparable<? super E>> BinarySearchTree<E> fromSortedList(List<E> sortedDistinct)
      Builds a perfectly balanced AVL tree from a sorted, distinct list in O(n).

      No insertions or rotations are performed; nodes are linked bottom-up and heights are computed as the recursion unwinds.

      Type Parameters:
      E - element type
      Parameters:
      sortedDistinct - a sorted list of distinct keys
      Returns:
      a new AVL tree containing all elements in sortedDistinct
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the list or any element is null

    • fromInclusiveRange

      public static BinarySearchTree<Integer> fromInclusiveRange(int minVal, int maxVal)
      Builds a balanced AVL tree with all integers in the inclusive range [minVal, maxVal] in O(n) time and without rotations.
      Parameters:
      minVal - the minimum value (inclusive)
      maxVal - the maximum value (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a new AVL tree containing every integer in the range
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if maxVal < minVal
